Job Title: Sr Director, Business Intelligence

Location: Scottsdale, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Blue Yonder Title: Sr Business Analytics Director

Other Job Titles: Director of Business Intelligence

Location: Virtual within the US. This individual will be expected to conduct regular meetings with teams in Global time zones including India and EMEA.

Overview

As a pioneer in cognitive business platforms, Blue Yonder offers advanced solutions in digital supply chain management and omni-channel commerce fulfillment. Headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona, and part of the Panasonic family since 2021, Blue Yonder is dedicated to empowering its clients to optimally fulfill customer demand . Blue Yonder is seeking a Senior Business Analytics Director. In this high-impact role, you will spearhead the strategic direction of our business analytics initiatives, driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will lead a dynamic team to optimize our cognitive business platform, ensuring our solutions continue to empower retailers, manufacturers, and logistics providers in meeting evolving customer demands. Your leadership will be instrumental in harnessing the power of data to shape the future of supply chain solutions.

Scope

This role of Senior Business Analytics Director is critical for driving Blue Yonder’s continued success and innovation in the supply chain industry. The ideal candidate will bring a visionary approach to data and analytics, propelling the company towards new heights of efficiency and market leadership.

What You’ll Do

Develop and execute a comprehensive analytics strategy that aligns with Blue Yonder’s business goals and enhances our market-leading position in digital supply chain managementLead, mentor, and expand the Business Analytics team, fostering a culture of innovation, excellence, and continuous learningEngage with senior stakeholders across the organization to identify critical business needs and opportunities where analytics can drive significant valueOversee the development of advanced analytical tools and models to improve decision-making processes and business outcomesDrive the adoption of analytics solutions throughout the organization, ensuring they are effectively integrated into business processes and operationsStay abreast of industry trends and technological advancements in analytics and supply chain management, integrating these insights into Blue Yonder's strategy

What Are We Looking For

Advanced degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related fieldMinimum of 4 years of experience leading a large advanced analytics teamDemonstrated success in leading large analytics teams and initiatives in a dynamic and complex business environmentDeep understanding of data analytics methodologies, tools, and platformsExceptional leadership and communication skills, with a proven ability to influence at all levels of the organizationStrategic thinker with a strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business strategiesMinimum of 5 years of experience in Tableau or Power BIMinimum of 5 years of experience in SQLMinimum of 3 years of experience in SnowflakeMinimum of 3 years of experience in DatabricksMinimum of 3 years of experience in R/Python

Nice To Have

Experience in a multinational corporation or a similar complex organizational structureA track record of innovation in the field of business analytics or supply chain management

The salary range for this position is $168,000 - $194,000.

The salary range information provided, reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual salary will be commensurate with skills, experience, certifications or licenses and other relevant factors. In addition, this role will be eligible to participate in either the annual performance bonus or commission program, determined by the nature of the position.

Benefits

At Blue Yonder, we care about the wellbeing of our employees and those most important to them. This is reflected in our robust benefits package and options that includes:

Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision 401K with Matching Flexible Time Off Corporate Fitness Program Wellbeing Days A variety of voluntary benefits such as; Legal Plans, Accident and Hospital Indemnity, Pet Insurance and much more

At Blue Yonder, we are committed to a workplace that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging in which everyone can share their unique voices and talents in a safe space. We continue to be guided by our core values and are proud of our diverse culture as an equal opportunity employer. We understand that your career search may look different than others, and embrace the professional, personal, educational, and volunteer opportunities through which people gain experience.

Our Values

If you want to know the heart of a company, take a look at their values. Ours unite us. They are what drive our success – and the success of our customers. Does your heart beat like ours? Find out here: Core Values

Diversity, Inclusion, Value & Equality (DIVE) is our strategy for fostering an inclusive environment we can be proud of. Check out Blue Yonder's inaugural Diversity Report which outlines our commitment to change, and our video celebrating the differences in all of us in the words of some of our associates from around the world.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): None
